str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Original, primitive, ancient. From arche; original or primeval.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and erchomai; to come near or aside, i.e. To approach, go by, perish or neglect, avert.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
